segment.target: Charges are the number of times you can use an object. **Charged** objects regain **one** charge per cycle.
This object is hidden. It can only be seen by you. Warning! A hidden object can be discovered by another player if they search the room.
This object doesn't work anymore. It must be repaired before it can be used again.
This food is dubious at best.
This food shouldn't be given to anyone of a fragile disposition, consumption could prove dangerous.
This food should be destroyed without delay, ingestion of any quantity is extremely dangerous and could prove fatal.
This food is hyper-frozen. Consumption in this state will prove difficult.
This object is contaminated, the first crewmenber (Mush or not) who uses it will be infected by a spore. You can see this message because you are one of the Mush.
This plant is still young. It won't produce fruit or oxygen until it reaches maturity.
This plant is **Thirsty**, it now produces only oxygen. If it isn't watered, it will become **Dried Out** tomorrow.
This plant is **Dried Out**, it now produces neither fruits nor oxygen. If it isn't watered, it will be **Dead** tomorrow.
This plant is **Diseased**, it produces neither fruits nor oxygen.
It's not as if it wasn't fresh...
A particularly tenacious heavy migraine is harassing the patient at the moment, but it'll eventually go away...
Headaches, dry pustules, extremely tired. You should make it through.
You feel a little bit shady... It will pass, but you're not hungry anymore and you shouldn't go anywhere near bluuuuuurppp...
A particularly tenacious heavy migraine hits you from time to time... and when it hits you it turns everything upside down... no luck.
You have chronic vertigo which proves to be quite debilitating.
You launch hugh streams of insults without warning. This tends to shock people the first time they see it.
From time to time you take to walking sideways or throwing yourself to the ground only to return to brief periods of normalcy.
You suffer constantly. Life has become so long, too long and every and every test makes you increasing lose your taste for it.
You are in fear for you life and eventually make it known
You have chronic vertigo which proves to be quite debilitating
Your hand will no longer be any good to you
Chooses the destination of the Daedalus. They are also the only person capable of setting the ship in motion.
The Communications officer can start to contact others once contact with Sol has been re-established.
The NERON Administrator can access NERON's BIOS. They also have privileged access to the daily operations systems.
At the start of each cycle, is the antisocial player is in a room containing another crewmember, they'll lose a morale point.
You are capable of brainsynching which allows you to dispense with the walkie-talkie.
You are carrying particularly heavy objects. Your movements will cost you more.
You need to get a hold of yourself quick-smart. Morale is not good and that can cost you vital turns.
You are filthy and you stink... A quick spin under the shower wouldn't hurt. Take this chance to put on some deodorant.
The disabled crewmate gets 2 :pm: less during conversions of :pa:-:pm:. However, they can freely leave a room when a crew member is present.
Your next Research or Repair is successful.
You've never done it. Your first time will refill your morale to the max.
You are currently accessing a terminal. You appear to be concentrating hard.
You've eaten a mountain of food. It's now impossible to ingest anything at all!
Someone has had enough of your incessant whining.
You lose one morale (:pmo:) point for every cycle you remain dirty. You're also banned from stroking the cat.
When a guardian is in the room, the visitor can {b}only{\b} go back to where they came from.
You have been flagged as Highly Inactive. You haven't logged in for 48h, you are penalizing the crew who have to deal with you.
You earn 1 :pm: per cycle.//You don't earn any additional :pa: when lying down.
The immunized cannot be infected by the Mush. Practical when you're not sure who to trust...
You missed the last trip out of this hole, and have been in better moods.
Our sensors have detected that this crewmember has several parallel identities. Please encourage them to contact the SDF to resolve this situation.

You have been judged by the others. A heavy burden weighs on your shoulders. They point at you, they spy on you, and they watch you closely. You are the whipping-boy. The victim.//Your {b]secret{\b} actions become {b}covert{\b}. It is harder for you to do everything.
Wherever you are, aggressive actions cost an additional 2 :pa:.
You are expecting a happy event! This gives you a :triumph: bonus, and if you die, the :pmo: of the crew will be seriously affected.
A spore is used to infect other members of the crew
It's been a long time since you ate anything. Every cycle in which you don't eat will cost you 1 :hp:.
The crew is seriously **hungry**. You must find something to eat.
You do not have the necessary equipment to explore this planet. You are forced to stay aboard the ship...
Even the sight of a plastic spoon gets you to thinking... find a way to get a hold of yourself... and QUICK!
NERON is installing updates. DO NOT TURN OFF THE device!!! 30%

At ease handling all kinds of weapons.// :point: +2 :pa_shoot: per day (**Shoot** Action Points).// :point: Expedition: +1 to combat strength, if you have a gun.// :point: Bonus for developing certain ** NERON projects **.

Qualified to repair materials, equipment and the hull of the Daedalus.// :point: +1 :pa_eng: per day (**Repair** Action Point).// :point: Can **Dismantle** objects.// :point: Chances to perform successful **Repairs** doubled.// :point: Chances to perform successful **Renovations** doubled.// :point: Bonus for developing certain **NERON projects**.
Has access to NERON's core twice per day (Free Actions).// :point: +2 :pa_core: per day (**NERON projects** Action Points) .// :point: Bonus for developing certain **NERON projects**.

The Shrink is in charge of psychological support. They are able to keep morale high and treat psychological illnesses.//:point: Each cycle, **1 Morale Point (:pmo:) is regained** by all crewmates lying down in the same room.//:point: **Treats psychological illnesses**.//:point: Grants the **Comfort** Action for raising morale.//:point: Bonus for developing certain **NERON projects**.
